intro: Ptyssiglottis pubisepala, commonly known as the hairy-sepaled ptyssiglottis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, with sepals that are notably hairy, contributing to its scientific name. Ptyssiglottis pubisepala is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
